meanings.definition: The action of paying back a loan or debt.
meanings.sent1: The repayment of the money was made on time.
meanings.sent2: She made a repayment towards her student loan every month.
meanings.sent3: The repayment of the chocolate bar she borrowed was a sweet gesture.
meanings.sent4: His repayment of kindness towards others was like a boomerang, always coming back to him.
meanings.sent5: The repayment of the favor was etched in her memory forever.

meanings.definition: The act of compensating for a loss or injury.
meanings.sent1: The insurance company provided a repayment for the damages.
meanings.sent2: He received a repayment for the time he lost due to the delay.
meanings.sent3: The repayment for the broken vase was a bit of a joke, but it lightened the mood.
meanings.sent4: Her repayment for the mistake was to work extra hours to make up for it.
meanings.sent5: The repayment for his injury was a warm hug from his friend.

meanings.definition: The return of something that was borrowed or taken.
meanings.sent1: The repayment of the book was long overdue.
meanings.sent2: She expected a repayment of her umbrella after the rain stopped.
meanings.sent3: The repayment of the pen she borrowed was accompanied by a smile.
meanings.sent4: The repayment of the stolen necklace was a relief to the owner.
meanings.sent5: The repayment of the favor was unexpected but greatly appreciated.
